content:
• Wednesday, November 21, 2012
  • KITD

    More on KIT Digital: The company says an event of default exists in a secured loan facility that...

    More on KIT Digital: The company says an event of default exists in a secured loan facility that has $11M outstanding; that its cash balance has dwindled to $10.6M ($4M of which is restricted), and that cash burn (partly due to restatement costs) is expected to continue. As a result, KIT is exploring "a broad set of strategic alternatives," including financing deals (virtually guaranteed to be dilutive) and a sale. It's also cancelling its 2012 shareholder meeting. OTC:KITD -58.9% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:42 PM
  • IMGN

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: IMGN +7.1%. SHLD +4.2%. ARRY +3.4%. IDIX +3.0%. VRTX...

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: IMGN +7.1%. SHLD +4.2%. ARRY +3.4%. IDIX +3.0%. VRTX +2.5%. 
    After-hours top losers: MRGE -9.0%. CVGI -7.1%. GORO -6.6%. HW -6.3%. QLIK -4.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:39 PM | 2 Comments
  • KITD

    KIT Digital (OTC:KITD) -52% AH after announcing errors will force restatement of prior...

    KIT Digital (OTC:KITD) -52% AH after announcing errors will force restatement of prior period financial statements and postponement of Q3 2012 results. The 2009, 2010 and 2011 years and the March and June quarters of 2012 will be restated; KITD says investors should no longer rely upon previously issued statements for those periods.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:19 PM
  • OCZ

    OCZ Technology (NASDAQ:OCZ) has resumed trading after disclosing it's on the receiving end of an...

    OCZ Technology (NASDAQ:OCZ) has resumed trading after disclosing it's on the receiving end of an SEC inquiry. Shares are down 7.6% AH to $1.10, putting them below the solid-state drive maker's all-time low of $1.15.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:01 PM | 1 Comment
  • OSUR

    The U.S. Preventative Services Task Force released an updated draft recommendation on HIV...

    The U.S. Preventative Services Task Force released an updated draft recommendation on HIV screening yesterday, with a recommendation for general screening of the 15 - 65 year old population. The recommendation is a significant expansion of it's previous position, which suggested screening only those at risk for HIV. The release gave a boost to Orasure (OSUR +1.4%) today, whose OraQuick Advance is the only FDA-approved rapid point-of-care test that can detect antibodies to both HIV-1 and HIV-2 in just 20 minutes.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM | 1 Comment
  • NLP

    NTS Realty Holdings (NLP +38.3%) skyrockets after its chairman and CEO last night raised their...

    NTS Realty Holdings (NLP +38.3%) skyrockets after its chairman and CEO last night raised their offer to take it private, valuing it at ~$81M after the company rejected their prior proposal. The two execs are now offering $7.30 per limited partnership unit, a 47% premium to the Tuesday closing price.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • COL

    B/E Aerospace (BEAV +1.2%) trades up today after Imperial Capital initiated coverage with an...

    B/E Aerospace (BEAV +1.2%) trades up today after Imperial Capital initiated coverage with an Outperform, saying the company is well positioned in its sector, and justifies the premium at which it currently trades. The company has little defense exposure, representing just 5 – 10% of total sales, which is a net positive as the outlook for defense spending will likely deteriorate as budget constraints pressure defense budgets over the next 2-4 years.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM
  • PWAV

    Powerwave (PWAV -6.9%) has fallen all the way to $0.34 after filing to sell 3.75M shares on...

    Powerwave (PWAV -6.9%) has fallen all the way to $0.34 after filing to sell 3.75M shares on behalf of P-Wave Holdings. The shares stem from warrants P-Wave received as part of a September credit agreement with Powerwave. Powerwave nearly doubled after the credit agreement was announced, but has since fully given back those gains. (S-3)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM
  • NOK

    After steadily climbing today on volume over 2x its daily average, Nokia (NOK +13.7%) is at...

    After steadily climbing today on volume over 2x its daily average, Nokia (NOK +13.7%) is at levels last seen in August. Optimism regarding Lumia 920 sales following some positive datapoints (I, II) could be a factor, though Swedish i-bank Handelsbanken cautioned this morning early Lumia 800/900 sales triggered a similar response. SA's Jacob Steinberg pointed out today net institutional ownership of Nokia has been rising.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 PM | 40 Comments
  • MDW

    Midway Gold (MDW +8.2%) shares pop after a trading halt, as the company announces it has...

    Midway Gold (MDW +8.2%) shares pop after a trading halt, as the company announces it has arranged a $70M private placement financing of five-year 8% convertible Series A Preferred shares at $1.85/share.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM | 1 Comment
  • XSPA

    Vringo (VRNG +5.3%) has jumped after the U.S. federal court overseeing its patent suit against...

    Vringo (VRNG +5.3%) has jumped after the U.S. federal court overseeing its patent suit against Google, AOL, and others confirmed the jury's infringement verdict and its recommended 3.5% royalty on U.S. AdWords revenue. Shares had calmed down in recent days after seeing tremendous volatility during the trial.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM | 12 Comments
  • DVAX

    Dynavax Technologies (DVAX +3%) gains today after hedge fund HealthCor Management acknowledged...

    Dynavax Technologies (DVAX +3%) gains today after hedge fund HealthCor Management acknowledged boosting its stake in the company to 9.18%, or 16.4M shares. This is up 105% from the 8M shares held at the end of the latest quarter ending September 30, 2012.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:05 PM | 1 Comment
  • GRPN

    Groupon (GRPN +15.3%) investors definitely have something to be thankful for today; shares are...

    Groupon (GRPN +15.3%) investors definitely have something to be thankful for today; shares are now up 25% since Tiger Global disclosed it owns 9.9% of the daily deals/e-commerce firm. Groupon, of course, has seen plenty of big short-covering rallies since it went public last year, but they haven't thus far changed the post-IPO trend.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM | 3 Comments
  • TLTHF

    Talison Lithium (OTC:TLTHF) says it will begin talks with Chengdu Tianqi to determine if the...

    Talison Lithium (OTC:TLTHF) says it will begin talks with Chengdu Tianqi to determine if the Chinese company’s C$806M takeover bid is superior to Rockwood Holdings' (ROC +1.5%) competing offer. Talison will consider factors including the funding of Chengdu Tianqi’s C$7.15/share bid and its timing. ROC says its August bid of $6.50/share is its best and final offer.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM
  • SQNM

    Sequenom (SQNM +12.2%) shares surge today after the American College of Obstetricians and...

    Sequenom (SQNM +12.2%) shares surge today after the American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists Committee on Genetics and the Society for Maternal-Fetal Medicine Publications Committee issue a joint opinion recommending that cell-free fetal DNA testing be offered to patients at increased risk of aneuploidy, and also as a follow-up test for women with a positive first-trimester or second-trimester screening test result.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM
  • HPR

    Oil and gas explorer Bill Barrett (BBG -3.8%) says a fire in a Utah gas field injured two...

    Oil and gas explorer Bill Barrett (BBG -3.8%) says a fire in a Utah gas field injured two employees and forced the shutdown of a compressor station there. Gas production from the field has been substantially shut in, and BBG expects to transport a majority of its gas production through its other facilities in the area.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM
  • GNMX

    Medgenics (MDGN +13.2%) gets a pop today after being granted a patent by the USPTO protecting...

    Medgenics (MDGN +13.2%) gets a pop today after being granted a patent by the USPTO protecting the use of the company's Epodure Biopump technology for the treatment of anemia. The patent agency also allowed claims covering a similar method for delivery underlying it's Hemodure Biopump technology for sustained prophylactic treatment of hemophilia. MDGN's global portfolio now includes 36 patents issued, with 81 more pending.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:18 PM
  • SODA

    SodaStream (SODA +4.7%) has popped after CEO Daniel Birnbaum gave a pep talk on CNBC. Birnbaum...

    SodaStream (SODA +4.7%) has popped after CEO Daniel Birnbaum gave a pep talk on CNBC. Birnbaum claimed it's "business as usual" for his company in spite of Israel's conflict with Hamas (previous), and noted the U.S. only makes up 28% of sales - SodaStream saw its Americas revenue rise 61% Y/Y in Q3.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM | 2 Comments
  • UNG

    Natural gas inventories fell 38bcf last week, more than expectations for 23-27bcf. This just in:...

    Natural gas inventories fell 38bcf last week, more than expectations for 23-27bcf. This just in: Natural gas is in a bull market (or at least a big bounce in a bear market), up another 0.9% today and about doubled from last spring's lows. UNG +1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM | 12 Comments
  • MYL

    Mylan (MYL +1.5%) says it's board has approved a buyback of up to $500M in common stock. The...

    Mylan (MYL +1.5%) says it's board has approved a buyback of up to $500M in common stock. The news follows an earlier report that Moody's had upgraded the company's credit ratings to Baa3 from Ba1 and that S&P raised its credit rating to BBB- from BB+.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM
  • MEMS

    Midday top 10 gainers: MEMS +72%. NLP +38%. ARCI +20%. INFI +14%. VVUS +14%. NCTY +13%. SKX...

    Midday top 10 gainers: MEMS +72%. NLP +38%. ARCI +20%. INFI +14%. VVUS +14%. NCTY +13%. SKX +12%. SQNM +11%. PSUN +11%. MTSL +11%. Midday top 10 Losers: STV -46%. ZLC -29%. CNET -18%. SCHL -18%. TLYS -17%. STJ -14%. CLNT -13%. EBR -11%. HGSH -11%. KID -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • THOR-OLD

    Thoratec (THOR-OLD +5.3%) trades higher today after Wells Fargo ups the shares to Outperform and...

    Thoratec (THOR-OLD +5.3%) trades higher today after Wells Fargo ups the shares to Outperform and raises its valuation by roughly 20%. The move comes a day after the FDA approved rival HeartWare International's (HTWR -5.4%) heart-pumping device, and Wells notes that THOR-OLD's competing product showed a lower incidence of stroke in recent trials.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM
  • FB

    Facebook (FB +5.8%) is rallying again in the wake of last Wednesday's lockup expiration; shares...

    Facebook (FB +5.8%) is rallying again in the wake of last Wednesday's lockup expiration; shares are now up 23% since 773M shares became eligible for sale. While short-covering ahead of Thanksgiving weekend is undoubtedly a factor, Facebook's trading volume is well above average on a low-volume day. This morning, French carrier Orange (FTE) announced Party Call, a service that allows Facebook users to place individual and group calls to each other via their smartphones, no numbers required.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:16 PM | 3 Comments
  • PSTI

    Pluristem (PSTI +2.5%) says the FDA has acknowledged that aplastic anemia is a rare disease,...

    Pluristem (PSTI +2.5%) says the FDA has acknowledged that aplastic anemia is a rare disease, confirming that potential treatments for the condition are eligible for orphan drug status. However, it also has requested that PSTI provide additional information and data for further analysis before the agency can determine if PLX cells can qualify for orphan drug designation for aplastic anemia. PSTI is focusing on the use of the cells to treat systemic diseases eliminate the need to use the intravenous route.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM | 3 Comments
  • EFII

    Electronics for Imaging (EFII +4.4%) and Novatel (NVTL -3.9%) go in opposite directions on news...

    Electronics for Imaging (EFII +4.4%) and Novatel (NVTL -3.9%) go in opposite directions on news the former company will be added to the S&P MidCap 600, and the latter removed, after Tuesday's close. Bank holding firm Banner (BANR +1%) is also joining the index, and 3M acquisition target Ceradyne (CRDN) leaving. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM
  • WNC

    Wabash National (WNC +9.3%) shares surge as ACT Research's October Trailer Flash Report out last...

    Wabash National (WNC +9.3%) shares surge as ACT Research's October Trailer Flash Report out last night was stronger than expected, as total van net orders jumped 55% Y/Y and 45% M/M, and total net trailer orders improved 31% and 42% respectively. FBR Capital strongly reiterates an Outperform rating on WNC with a $12 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM
  • GNOM

    BGI-Shenzhen has again extended the deadline for its tender offer to acquire Complete Genomics...

    BGI-Shenzhen has again extended the deadline for its tender offer to acquire Complete Genomics (GNOM +1.6%), a move that comes in response to Illumina's (ILMN +0.8%) recently disclosed competing bid earlier this month that was rejected by the life sciences company. BGI's tender offer now expires on December 14.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM
  • FIO

    Fusion-io (FIO +6.1%) has shot higher over the last 45 minutes of trading. The Fly on the Wall...

    Fusion-io (FIO +6.1%) has shot higher over the last 45 minutes of trading. The Fly on the Wall attributes the move to M&A rumors, something Fusion-io receives virtually every other week. 21.5M shares were shorted as of Oct. 31.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM | 3 Comments
  • LXU

    LSB Industries (LXU -7.9%) stops production at the principal ammonia plant at its Pryor, Okla.,...

    LSB Industries (LXU -7.9%) stops production at the principal ammonia plant at its Pryor, Okla., chemical facility to perform unplanned maintenance on a compressor. LXU estimates an outage of 6-8 weeks with the downtime adversely affect operating income by ~$2M/week.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM
  • YY

    YY has delivered a solid, if unspectacular, IPO. Shares opened at $10.69 and have since risen to...

    YY has delivered a solid, if unspectacular, IPO. Shares opened at $10.69 and have since risen to $11.74, good for an 11.8% gain. YY's IPO price of $10.50 was at the low end of a $10.50-$12.50 range. (previous) (F-1)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • CRM

    Salesforce.com (CRM +6.6%) is now staring at big gains in response to its FQ3 report (I, II),...

    Salesforce.com (CRM +6.6%) is now staring at big gains in response to its FQ3 report (I, II), and is also giving a lift to peers Workday (WDAY +1.9%) and NetSuite (N +2%). Though guidance wasn't impressive, Needham and others are satisfied with Salesforce's 31% Y/Y bookings growth, given macro and IT spending headwinds. Marc Benioff, never shy to brag, mentioned on the earnings call Heroku and Force.com now host over 2.8M apps, and that several big deals were signed for the new Marketing Cloud suite.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM
  • BBY

    Also piling on Best Buy (BBY -3%) is Fitch, slashing the firm's credit rating to BB- with...

    Also piling on Best Buy (BBY -3%) is Fitch, slashing the firm's credit rating to BB- with negative outlook. Financial leverage hit 2.9X at the end of Q3, up from 2.6X at the end of 2011, and Fitch believes it could hit the 4X area in 2013-14. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM | 1 Comment
  • AET

    Weight loss drug makers get a lift today after Aetna (AET -0.6%) revises its criteria under...

    Weight loss drug makers get a lift today after Aetna (AET -0.6%) revises its criteria under which the insurer considers weight reduction medications as "medically necessary" for treatment of obesity. In a Clinical Policy Bulletin revision dated yesterday, AET identified certain medications that have been approved by the FDA for weight reduction which would be covered under its policy: Qsymia, marketed by VIVUS (VVUS +13.2%), Belviq from Arena Pharmaceuticals (ARNA +2.9%), Didrex from Pfizer (PFE +0.1%), Xenical from Roche (RHHBY +0.3) and GlaxoSmithKline's (GSK +0.2%) Alli. Orexigen (OREX +6.5%), although not named in the bulletin, is also higher on the news.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM | 11 Comments
  • BBY

    Best Buy (BBY -3.5%) isn't feeling any holiday cheer from the Street: shares are making new...

    Best Buy (BBY -3.5%) isn't feeling any holiday cheer from the Street: shares are making new multi-decade lows after receiving a flurry of target cuts in response to its FQ3 miss and cash flow guidance cut. Jefferies argues it's time for the electronics chain to dump its international business, which is bleeding cash and could be worth $3/share. Investors will be paying close attention to how Black Friday goes, and how Best Buy's price-matching offer is received in the following days.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM | 1 Comment
  • FLKOF

    Shares of Falkland Oil & Gas (OTCPK:FLKOF +16.8%) rise as much as 21% in London trading...

    Shares of Falkland Oil & Gas (OTCPK:FLKOF +16.8%) rise as much as 21% in London trading on speculation that drilling at its Scotia well in the Falkland Islands will lead to a discovery. Falkland and its partners, Noble Energy (NBL +0.2%) among them, are targeting ~1B barrels of oil at the well. "They're close to the target depth on Scotia," a Jefferies analyst says.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:50 AM
  • SRPT

    Sarepta Therapeutics (NASDAQ:SRPT) +8% to $29.16 after Piper Jaffray says the biotech has the...

    Sarepta Therapeutics (NASDAQ:SRPT) +8% to $29.16 after Piper Jaffray says the biotech has the potential to be a $160/share stock, although its nearer-term range could be $60-$80. Efsinvestment's Ahmed Ishtiaq wrote on Seeking Alpha this week that Sarepta is "ready to move higher." The company's lead drug is Eteplirsen for the treatment of Duchenne muscular dystrophy, which looks like it could be a blockbuster.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM
  • CAR

    The sell-side is showing some love for ZipCar (ZIP +4.9%) this week. A day after shares jumped...

    The sell-side is showing some love for ZipCar (ZIP +4.9%) this week. A day after shares jumped on a Goldman upgrade, they're doing the same thanks to an Avondale upgrade to Market Perform. Zipcar is now up 31% since delivering a Q3 beat and respectable guidance on Nov. 8.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM
  • SKX

    Skechers (SKX +11.7%) opens sharply higher after receiving an upgrade to Positive from...

    Skechers (SKX +11.7%) opens sharply higher after receiving an upgrade to Positive from Susquehanna. The shoemaker has been range-bound since May after having a nice run-up earlier in the year. (Q3 results)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:38 AM
  • BTH

    Blyth (NYSE:BTH) +4.3% premarket after announcing that its ViSalus personal health business will...

    Blyth (NYSE:BTH) +4.3% premarket after announcing that its ViSalus personal health business will pay a $22M dividend to its shareholders; BTH, as the majority shareholder, will receive 73% of the distribution.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM

  • Market preview: Stock futures are flat ahead of the not-quite long weekend that is Thanksgiving,...

    Market preview: Stock futures are flat ahead of the not-quite long weekend that is Thanksgiving, although EU shares are maintaining fairly solid gains on hopes that a deal over Greece is just a matter of time after eurozone finmins again delay the release of bailout money for the country. Following earnings, Scholastic plummets 23%, Zale is -13.8% and Deere is -3.2%. Later: Bloomberg Consumer Comfort Index, Reuters/UofM Consumer Sentiment
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM | 1 Comment
  • MEMS

    Memsic (NASDAQ:MEMS) +86.8% premarket after receiving an offer from IDG-Accel China Growth Fund...

    Memsic (NASDAQ:MEMS) +86.8% premarket after receiving an offer from IDG-Accel China Growth Fund II to acquire all of the semiconductor sensor systems provider's shares IDG Capital Partners doesn't already own for $4/share in cash, representing a 130% premium to its Tuesday closing price.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM
  • MEMS

    Premarket gainers: MEMS +86%. VELT +10%. SQNM +6%. MIPS +5%. CRUS +5%.Losers: STV -43%. SCHL...

    Premarket gainers: MEMS +86%. VELT +10%. SQNM +6%. MIPS +5%. CRUS +5%.
    Losers: STV -43%. SCHL -23%. TLYS -15%. ACRX -10%. EBR -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • ZLC

    Zale (NYSE:ZLC) -13.8% premarket after FQ1 results missed estimates. Comparable store sales rose...

    Zale (NYSE:ZLC) -13.8% premarket after FQ1 results missed estimates. Comparable store sales rose 3.9% vs. a 5.8% rise in the same period last year. Fashion jewelry unit volume was offset by reduced average price per unit, the CFO says. ZLC reiterates expectations for positive net income for FY 2013; consensus calls for FY13 EPS of $0.35.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:07 AM
  • DE

    More on Deere (NYSE:DE) FQ4 earnings: The company expects FY2013 EPS of about $8.14 vs....

    More on Deere (NYSE:DE) FQ4 earnings: The company expects FY2013 EPS of about $8.14 vs. consensus $8.31, citing "fragile economic conditions in many regions." Net equipment sales +14% in Q4, +14% Y/Y, and expected to rise 5% in 2013. Shares -1.2% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:17 AM
